page.title: 16Denmead's Schools.
page.content: The pattern of education in Denmead and Wecock has been changing over the past few years. This is because of changing patterns of population dispersal. In Denmead the old Victorian school, at the eastern end of the village, was closed in the 1970's and turned into a Community Centre. To replace this an Infants and a Junior School were built on seperate sites within the housing development at the west of the village. With new development these may have to be expanded. In Wecock a purpose built modern school has been created very recently. Cowplain Wecock First and Middle Schools have a large site and well designed modern facilities. These serve all of Wecock and should not need to expand in the near future.
